# Battle of Jaguarão

*Imperial Army
| combatant2        =
*Uruguayan Army
| commander1        =  Manoel Vargas
| commander2        =  Basilio Muñoz  Timoteo Aparicio
| strength1         = 90 infantrymen400 cavalrymen
| strength2         = 1,500 cavalrymen
| casualties1       = 2 killed4 wounded
| casualties2       = 6 killed20 wounded
| campaignbox       =
}}
The Battle of Jaguarão was fought in the town of Jaguarão in the then province of Rio Grande do Sul, on 27 January 1865, between the Imperial Brazilian Army and a Uruguayan militia during the Uruguayan War.
